generatedTitle: The History of "I'll Be Home for Christmas" Songwriters

extractFactDictList.question: Who wrote the song 'I'll Be Home for Christmas'?
extractFactDictList.sentence: The song 'I'll Be Home for Christmas' was written by lyricist Kim Gannon and composer Walter Kent.
extractFactDictList.phrase: Lyricist Kim Gannon and composer Walter Kent

extractFactDictList.question: Who originally recorded 'I'll Be Home for Christmas' in 1943?
extractFactDictList.sentence: It was originally recorded in 1943 by Bing Crosby, who scored a top ten hit with the song.

extractFactDictList.question: Why was the song 'I'll Be Home for Christmas' written?
extractFactDictList.sentence: The song was written to honor soldiers overseas who longed to be home at Christmas time.
extractFactDictList.phrase: To honor soldiers overseas who longed to be home at Christmas time

extractFactDictList.question: Who was credited as a co-writer of the song after a lawsuit?
extractFactDictList.sentence: Songwriter Buck Ram, who said he previously wrote a poem and song with the same title, was credited as a co-writer of the song following a lawsuit brought by Ram's publisher, Mills Music.

extractFactDictList.question: What was listed on the original 1943 release of the song by Bing Crosby?
extractFactDictList.sentence: Bing Crosby's original 1943 release of the song on Decca Records listed only Walter Kent and Kim Gannon as the songwriters on the record label.
extractFactDictList.phrase: Only Walter Kent and Kim Gannon as the songwriters

extractFactDictList.question: What did later pressings of the song add to the songwriting credit?
extractFactDictList.sentence: Later pressings added the name of Buck Ram to the songwriting credit.
